item.title: Angina
item.description: Angina # Pain due to partial blockage of a coronary vessel. Can be stable or unstable stable angina (more common) – attacks have a trigger (such as stress or exercise) and stop within a few minutes of resting unstable angina (more serious) – attacks are more unpredictable (they may not have a trigger) and can continue despite resting Some people develop unstable angina after having stable angina.

item.title: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
item.description: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia # Increased number of both stromal and glandular cells in the prostate Causes/Factors # Old men Obesity Diabetes FH Clinical Features # Lower urinary tract symptoms Diagnostic Tests # Management # Complications/red Flags #

item.title: Cryptorchidism
item.description: Cryptorchidism # aka undescended testis Many babies can be born within the 25-35 week window without testis decent

item.title: Glomerulonephritis
item.description: Glomerulonephritis # Immune system attacks glomeruli Causes/Factors # Symptoms # [[Nephrotic syndrome]] oedema hypoalbuminemia proteinuria >3.5g/day [[Nephritic syndrome]]

item.title: Infectious Mononucleosis
item.description: Infectious Mononucleosis # Glandular fever Spread through saliva caused almost exclusively from EBV Causes/Factors # Symptoms # Signs # Diagnostic Tests # Blood sample for EBV VCA IgM and IgG Throat swabs Management # Complications/red Flags # Avoid ampicillin & amoxycillin with EBV as may cause rash

item.title: Minimal Change Disease
item.description: Minimal Change Disease # No change on histology under light microscopy Causes/Factors # Child NSAID Symptoms # [[Nephrotic syndrome]] normal eGFR Signs # Diagnostic Tests # Management # Complications/red Flags #

item.title: Nephritic Syndrome
item.description: Nephritic Syndrome # Haematuria in nephritic proteinuria in [[Nephrotic syndrome]] Causes/Factors # Symptoms # Oedemia mild proteinuria haematuria hypertension renal failure Signs # Diagnostic Tests # Management # Complications/red Flags #

item.title: Pinna Cellulitis
item.description: Pinna Cellulitis # Associated with trauma (ear piercing & accupuncture) surgery or burns Perichondritis - complicated on high ear piercing

item.title: Polycystic Kidney Disease
item.description: Polycystic Kidney Disease # Polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD) is an inherited condition that causes small fluid-filled sacs called cysts to develop in the kidneys.

item.title: Prostatic Adenocarcinoma
item.description: Prostatic Adenocarcinoma # Cancer of the glandular epithelium in the prostate Causes/Factors # Male% Ethnicity FH - BRCA1/2 Pesticide exposure Risk of cancer $\approx$ age

item.title: Pyoderma Gangrenosum
item.description: Pyoderma Gangrenosum # Pyoderma gangrenosum is a rare skin condition that causes painful ulcers. It’s usually treatable but can take some time to heal and may leave some scarring.

item.title: Seminoma
item.description: Seminoma # Malignant neoplasm of the testis arising form germ cells in the seminiferous tubules Most common type of testicular cancer

item.title: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
item.description: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus # Anti-DNA reaction so can present in any system Causes/Factors # Symptoms # Signs # Diagnostic Tests # Management # Complications/red Flags #

item.title: Tonsillitis & Pharyngitis
item.description: Tonsillitis & Pharyngitis # Causes/Factors # Most commonly caused by viruses - rhino, corona, influenza, adeno Symptoms # Sore throat Flu like symptoms Signs # Diagnostic Tests # FeverPAIN Criteria - to determine whether antibiotics might be needed

item.title: Tubulointerstitial Nephritis
item.description: Tubulointerstitial Nephritis # Type IV hypersensitivity reaction against tubules/interstitium IT IS NOT Acute tubular necrosis (ATN) - direct epithelial damage due to toxins/ischaemia

item.title: Upper and Lower Limb Neurological Exam
item.description: Upper and Lower Limb Neurological Exam # Introduction # Wash hands (and don PPE if needed) Introduce yourself (name and role) Confirm patient’s name and DOB Explain what the examination involves Gain consent to continue Ask if patient in any pain before continuing General Inspection # Clinical Signs # Watch gait as they walk in/ask them to walk Objects and Equipment # Medical equipment - oxygen, ECG, medications, catheters (note volume and colour), IV access Mobility aids Pillows - congestive [[heart failure]] patients typically suffer from orthopnoea Vital sign charts Fluid balance charts Prescription Hands # Inspection # To Complete the Exam # Explain to the patient that the examination is now finished.

item.title: Urothelial Carcinoma
item.description: Urothelial Carcinoma # aka transitional cell carcinoma Cancer arising from urothelium accounts for >90% of bladder Causes/Factors # Age 60+ Males Exposure to certain industrial chemicals Smoking FH Treatment for other cancers in pelvis - radiation from treatment can cause cancer Clinical Signs # Local Primary Tumour Effects # Frequency, urgency, dysuria Haematuria Urinary obstruction Effects of Distant Metastases # Lungs Bone Liver Paraneoplastic Syndromes # Rare
